csharp_simple:
1using System;
2using System.Collections.Generic;
3​
4namespace TechnicalIndicators
5{
6 /// <summary>
7 /// Qstick Indicator (Tushar Chande)
8 /// </summary>
9 /// <remarks>
10 /// Moving average of the difference between Close and Open prices.
11 /// <list type="bullet">
12 /// <item><description>Quantifies the strength of candlesticks.</description></item>
13 /// <item><description>Posituve: Buying pressure (Close > Open on average).</description></item>
14 /// <item><description>Negative: Selling pressure (Open > Close on average).</description></item>
15 /// </list>
16 /// </remarks>
17 public class Qstick
18 {
19 public int Period { get; }
20 public List<decimal?> Values { get; } = new();
21​
22 public Qstick(int period = 8)
23 {
24 if (period <= 0) throw new ArgumentOutOfRangeException(nameof(period));
25 Period = period;
26 }
27​
28 public void Calculate(IEnumerable<CandleData> candles)
29 {
30 Values.Clear();
31 var candleList = new List<CandleData>(candles);
32 if (candleList.Count == 0) return;
33​
34 var closeOpenDiff = new List<decimal>();
35 foreach (var c in candleList)
36 closeOpenDiff.Add(c.Close - c.Open);
37​
38 decimal sum = 0;
39 for (int i = 0; i < candleList.Count; i++)
40 {
41 sum += closeOpenDiff[i];
42 if (i >= Period)
43 sum -= closeOpenDiff[i - Period];
44​
45 if (i < Period - 1)
46 Values.Add(null);
47 else
48 Values.Add(sum / Period);
49 }
50 }
51​
52 public static List<decimal?> Calculate(IEnumerable<CandleData> candles, int period = 8)
53 {
54 var qs = new Qstick(period);
55 qs.Calculate(candles);
56 return qs.Values;
57 }
58 }
59}
csharp_detailed:
1// =============================================================================
2// QSTICK INDICATOR - Extreme Tutorial Mode
3// =============================================================================
4//
5// [What] Qstick is a candlestick-based momentum indicator developed by
6// Tushar Chande. It calculates the Simple Moving Average (SMA) of the
7// difference between Close and Open prices (the "body" of candlesticks).
8//
9// [Why] Candlestick bodies reveal buying/selling pressure:
10// - Bullish (Close > Open): Body is positive → buyers won
11// - Bearish (Close < Open): Body is negative → sellers won
12// Averaging these bodies over time shows the dominant force.
13//
14// [Visual] Candlestick Body Concept:
15//
16// Bullish Candle Bearish Candle Doji
17// ┌───┐ ┌───┐ ┌─┬─┐
18// │ │ ← Close │███│ ← Open │ │ │ ← Close ≈ Open
19// │ │ │███│ └─┴─┘
20// │ │ │███│
21// └───┘ ← Open └───┘ ← Close Body ≈ 0
22//
23// Body = Close - Open
24// Bullish: Body > 0
25// Bearish: Body < 0
26// Neutral: Body ≈ 0
27//
28// [How] Algorithm Overview:
29//
30// ┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
31// │ STEP 1: Calculate Body for Each Bar │
32// │ closeOpenDiff[i] = Close[i] - Open[i] │
33// ├─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┤
34// │ STEP 2: Apply Simple Moving Average (SMA) │
35// │ Qstick = Average of last 'Period' body values │
36// └─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘
37//
38// [Formula]
39// Qstick = SMA(Close - Open, Period)
40//
41// [Trading Signals]
42// Qstick > 0: Bullish dominance (more buying pressure)
43// Qstick < 0: Bearish dominance (more selling pressure)
44// Zero crossover ↑: Bullish signal (momentum shifting up)
45// Zero crossover ↓: Bearish signal (momentum shifting down)
46//
47// =============================================================================
48​
49using System;
50using System.Collections.Generic;
51​
52namespace TechnicalIndicators
53{
54 // =========================================================================
55 // [What] CandleData: Immutable record for OHLCV price bar data
56 // =========================================================================
57 public readonly record struct CandleData(
58 DateTime Timestamp,
59 decimal Open,
60 decimal High,
61 decimal Low,
62 decimal Close,
63 long Volume
64 );
65​
66 // =========================================================================
67 // [What] Qstick Class: Candlestick body momentum indicator
68 // =========================================================================
69 public class Qstick
70 {
71 // ---------------------------------------------------------------------
72 // [What] Period: Number of bars for the moving average
73 // [Why] Default 8 provides responsive but smoothed signals
74 // ---------------------------------------------------------------------
75 public int Period { get; }
76​
77 // ---------------------------------------------------------------------
78 // [What] Values: Stores the calculated Qstick for each bar
79 // ---------------------------------------------------------------------
80 public List<decimal?> Values { get; } = new();
81​
82 // =====================================================================
83 // [What] Constructor: Initialize with smoothing period
84 // =====================================================================
85 public Qstick(int period = 8)
86 {
87 if (period <= 0)
88 throw new ArgumentOutOfRangeException(nameof(period), "Period must be greater than 0");
89 Period = period;
90 }
91​
92 // =====================================================================
93 // [What] Calculate: Main computation method
94 // =====================================================================
95 //
96 // [IPO Block]
97 // ┌──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
98 // │ INPUT: candles - Collection of OHLCV price bars │
99 // │ PROCESS: Compute candle bodies, apply rolling SMA │
100 // │ OUTPUT: Values list with Qstick for each bar │
101 // └──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘
102 //
103 public void Calculate(IEnumerable<CandleData> candles)
104 {
105 Values.Clear();
106 var candleList = new List<CandleData>(candles);
107 if (candleList.Count == 0) return;
108​
109 // =================================================================
110 // PHASE 1: Calculate Candlestick Bodies (Close - Open)
111 // =================================================================
112 //
113 // [What] For each candle, compute the body size and direction
114 //
115 // [Visual] Body Calculation Example:
116 // Bar 0: Open=100, Close=102 → Body = +2 (Bullish)
117 // Bar 1: Open=102, Close=99 → Body = -3 (Bearish)
118 // Bar 2: Open=99, Close=99 → Body = 0 (Doji)
119 //
120 // -----------------------------------------------------------------
121 var closeOpenDiff = new List<decimal>();
122 foreach (var c in candleList)
123 closeOpenDiff.Add(c.Close - c.Open);
124​
125 // =================================================================
126 // PHASE 2: Apply Efficient Rolling SMA
127 // =================================================================
128 //
129 // [What] Calculate SMA using a running sum (sliding window technique)
130 //
131 // [Why] Instead of re-summing 'Period' values each iteration,
132 // we maintain a running sum:
133 // - Add new value
134 // - Subtract old value that falls out of window
135 // This is O(1) per bar instead of O(Period).
136 //
137 // [Visual] Sliding Window SMA (Period = 3):
138 //
139 // Bodies: [ 2 ] [ -3 ] [ 0 ] [ 4 ] [ -1 ]
140 //
141 // i=0: sum = 2 → window incomplete, null
142 // i=1: sum = 2 + (-3) = -1 → window incomplete, null
143 // i=2: sum = -1 + 0 = -1 → Qstick = -1/3 = -0.33
144 // i=3: sum = -1 + 4 - 2 = 1 → Qstick = 1/3 = 0.33
145 // i=4: sum = 1 + (-1) - (-3) = 3 → Qstick = 3/3 = 1.00
146 // [add new] [remove oldest]
147 //
148 // -----------------------------------------------------------------
149 decimal sum = 0;
150​
151 for (int i = 0; i < candleList.Count; i++)
152 {
153 // -------------------------------------------------------------
154 // [What] Add current body to rolling sum
155 // -----------------------------------------------------------------
156 sum += closeOpenDiff[i];
157​
158 // -------------------------------------------------------------
159 // [What] Remove oldest body when window exceeds Period
160 // [Why] Keeps sum representing exactly 'Period' bars
161 //
162 // [Visual] Window Sliding:
163 // Before (i=3, Period=3): Window = [i-2, i-1, i] = [1, 2, 3]
164 // After: Remove bodies[0] → Window = [1, 2, 3]
165 //
166 // When i >= Period, remove closeOpenDiff[i - Period]
167 // -------------------------------------------------------------
168 if (i >= Period)
169 sum -= closeOpenDiff[i - Period];
170​
171 // -------------------------------------------------------------
172 // [What] Output null during warm-up, average after
173 //
174 // [Why] First (Period - 1) bars don't have enough data
175 //
176 // [Logic]
177 // i < Period - 1: Output null (insufficient data)
178 // i >= Period - 1: Output sum / Period (valid Qstick)
179 // -------------------------------------------------------------
180 if (i < Period - 1)
181 Values.Add(null);
182 else
183 Values.Add(sum / Period);
184 }
185 }
186​
187 // =====================================================================
188 // [What] Calculate: Static convenience method
189 // =====================================================================
190 //
191 // [IPO Block]
192 // ┌──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
193 // │ INPUT: candles - Price bars, period - SMA window size │
194 // │ PROCESS: Create instance, calculate, return results │
195 // │ OUTPUT: List of Qstick values for each bar │
196 // └──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘
197 //
198 public static List<decimal?> Calculate(IEnumerable<CandleData> candles, int period = 8)
199 {
200 var qs = new Qstick(period);
201 qs.Calculate(candles);
202 return qs.Values;
203 }
204 }
205}
python_simple:
1class Qstick:
2 """
3 Qstick
4 SMA of (Close - Open).
5 """
6 def __init__(self, period=8):
7 self.period = period
8 self.values = []
9​
10 def calculate(self, candles):
11 self.values.clear()
12 if len(candles) == 0: return
13​
14 diffs = []
15 for c in candles:
16 diffs.append(float(c['close']) - float(c['open']))
17​
18 s = 0.0
19 for i in range(len(candles)):
20 s += diffs[i]
21 if i >= self.period:
22 s -= diffs[i - self.period]
23
24 if i < self.period - 1:
25 self.values.append(None)
26 else:
27 self.values.append(s / self.period)
28​
29def calculate(candles, period=8):
30 qs = Qstick(period)
31 qs.calculate(candles)
32 return qs.values
python_detailed:
1# =============================================================================
2# Logic Breakdown (Qstick)
3# =============================================================================
4#
5# This document provides a "Deep Dive" into the internal logic of the
6# Qstick indicator.
7#
8# [Core Concepts]
9# 1. Candlestick Quantified
10# - In candlestick charting, a "White" (or Green) candle means Close > Open.
11# - A "Black" (or Red) candle means Close < Open.
12# - Qstick assigns a numerical value to this: (Close - Open).
13#
14# 2. Moving Average of Body Size
15# - Qstick is simply a Simple Moving Average (SMA) of these (Close - Open) values.
16# - It smoothes out the day-to-day noise to reveal the underlying buying
17# or selling pressure.
18#
19# 3. Interpretation
20# - Positive Qstick: Average candle is White (Buying Pressure).
21# - Negative Qstick: Average candle is Black (Selling Pressure).
22# - Zero Crossing: Often signals a trend change.
23#
24# =============================================================================
25​
26# -------------------------------------------------------------
27# Type-Level Explanation: Qstick (class)
28#
29# [Why] Converts visual candlestick patterns into a sortable number.
30# [What] Trend indicator based on intraday momentum.
31# [Who] Tushar Chande.
32# -------------------------------------------------------------
33class Qstick:
34
35 # -------------------------------------------------------------
36 # Constructor: __init__
37 # [Why] Configure smoothing period.
38 # -------------------------------------------------------------
39 def __init__(self, period=8):
40 if period <= 0:
41 raise ValueError("period must be > 0")
42 self.period = period
43 self.values = []
44​
45 # =============================================================================
46 # IPO: calculate
47 # =============================================================================
48 #
49 # [Input]
50 # - candles: List[dict]
51 #
52 # [Process]
53 # 1. Calculate (Close - Open) for every bar.
54 # 2. Apply a Sliding Window SMA to this series.
55 # 3. Store result.
56 #
57 # [Output]
58 # - None (Populates 'values')
59 # =============================================================================
60 def calculate(self, candles):
61
62 # -------------------------------------------------------------
63 # Logic Step 1: Reset
64 #
65 # [Why] Clear previous state.
66 # [How] values.clear().
67 # -------------------------------------------------------------
68 self.values.clear()
69 if len(candles) == 0:
70 return
71​
72 # -------------------------------------------------------------
73 # Logic Step 2: Pre-Calculate Differences
74 #
75 # [Why]
76 # We simplify the SMA loop by having a clean list of numbers first.
77 # [How]
78 # Iterate candles, compute (Close - Open).
79 # [Visual]
80 # Bar 1: Open=100, Close=102 -> +2
81 # Bar 2: Open=103, Close=100 -> -3
82 # Series: [2, -3, ...]
83 # -------------------------------------------------------------
84 diffs = []
85 for c in candles:
86 diffs.append(c['close'] - c['open'])
87​
88 # -------------------------------------------------------------
89 # Logic Step 3: SMA Sliding Window
90 #
91 # [Why]
92 # Used to smooth the volatile daily differences.
93 # Uses Running Sum (O(N) efficiency).
94 # [How]
95 # Add new, remove old (Sliding Window).
96 # -------------------------------------------------------------
97 running_sum = 0.0
98
99 for i in range(len(candles)):
100
101 # Logic Step 3.1: Add New Value
102 # [Why] Update window sum with the latest data point.
103 # [How] += diffs[i]
104 running_sum += diffs[i]
105
106 # Logic Step 3.2: Remove Old Value
107 # [Why] Maintain strict window size.
108 # [How] -= diffs[i - period]
109 # If window is full, subtract the value that's falling off the back.
110 if i >= self.period:
111 running_sum -= diffs[i - self.period]
112
113 # Logic Step 3.3: Store Average
114 # [Why] Final indicator value is the average of the window.
115 # [How] Sum / Period.
116 if i < self.period - 1:
117 # Not enough data yet
118 self.values.append(None)
119 else:
120 average = running_sum / self.period
121 self.values.append(average)
122​
123# =============================================================================
124# Static Wrapper Function
125# =============================================================================
126#
127# [Why] Functional API.
128# [Usage] q_values = calculate(candles, period=8)
129# =============================================================================
130def calculate(candles, period=8):
131 instance = Qstick(period)
132 instance.calculate(candles)
133 return instance.values
